item.title: Named Query Filters in EF 10 (multiple filters per entity)
item.description: EF 10 introduces named query filters, allowing multiple filters on a single entity and letting you selectively disable specific filters without turning off all query filters. This article explains how the feature works, shows practical examples for combining soft deletion and multi-tenancy, highlights best practices like using constants for filter names, and explores where such fine-grained control is particularly useful.

item.title: Unleashing the Power of Asahi Linux on M4 Macs
item.description: Asahi Linux has emerged as a revolutionary project, enabling Linux to run natively on Apple's ARM - based Macs. With the advent of the M4 chips in Mac devices, Asahi Linux continues to adapt and expand its capabilities. This blog aims to provide a comprehensive guide to Asahi Linux on M4 Macs, covering fundamental concepts, usage methods, common practices, and best - known practices.

item.title: English Writes Numbers Backwards
item.description: Our eyes must scan to the end of a long number, then jump back to the start in order to read it. My modest proposal: flip how we write numbers.
